formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Haversine Formula: The Haversine formula calculates the great-circle distance between two points on a sphere given their longitudes and latitudes. This accounts for Earth's curvature. a = sin²(Δφ/2) + cos φ₁ ⋅ cos φ₂ ⋅ sin²(Δλ/2) c = 2 ⋅ atan2(√a, √(1−a)) d = R ⋅ c Where R = Earth's radius (6,371 km)

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: 2D Distance Formula: d = √[(x₂ - x₁)² + (y₂ - y₁)²] 3D Distance Formula: d = √[(x₂ - x₁)² + (y₂ - y₁)² + (z₂ - z₁)²]

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
